item.description:
This shoot is all about shape and style.

There will be two models for this shoot.

There will be two basic setups combining the curves of the female figure with the light- and shape-altering fabric of various materials.

In the first setup, we'll use translucent screens and particular back lighting to evoke dreamy images. We'll use the model's proximity to the screen and the positions of the light to play with the level of sharpness and accentuation of shapes. In this case, the model will be "screened" from view.

 

In the second setup, we'll use tailored spandex, using the model to shape the material. We'll change the lighting setups to provide an interesting dynamic to the subject and background. In this case, the model will be "melded" with the material.

 

Model and material costs, as well as everything else you need is included. Materials are sourced from the New York City garment district and tailored locally. The quality models chosen for this event will provide countless excellent images one would normally only get in a professional fashion studio. The number of photographers will be limited to as to allow plenty of time for each photographer to shoot. The materials, tailoring, and quality models are not inexpensive, so the fee for this meetup is quite a bargain.

Bring your camera and portrait lens equivalent. If your camera does not have a standard Nikon/Canon hotshoe mount, such is the case with many Sony SLRs, please contact us beforehand. If you'd like to try photos including movement (time permitting), bring a sturdy tripod as well.
item.name: Female Figure in Screens and Spandex
